original_content:
If you build electronics, you will eventually need a coil. If you spend any time winding one, you are almost guaranteed to think about building a coil winder. Maybe thats why so many people do. [Jtacha] did a take on the project, and we were impressed  it looks great.
The device has a keypad and an LCD. You can enter a number of turns or the desired inductance. It also lets you wind at an angle. So it is suitable for RF coils, Tesla coils, or any other reason you need a coil.

There are a number of 3D printed parts, so this doesnt look like an hour project. Luckily, none of the parts are too large. The main part is 2020 extrusion, and you will need to tap the ends of some of the pieces.
There is a brief and strangely dark video in the post if you want to see the machine in operation. The resulting coil looked good, especially if you compare it to how our hand-wound ones usually look.
While most of the coil winders we see have some type of motor, thats not a necessity.
title: - 自作コイル巻き機の魅力
body: コイルを巻く機械が話題。キーパッドとLCDで回転数設定可能。3Dプリント部品使用。
titles: - 自作コイル巻き機の魅力
- RFコイルやテスラコイルに最適な巻き機
- 3Dプリントで作るコイル巻き装置
- 角度調整可能なコイル巻き機の制作
- 手巻きと比較して美しい仕上がりのコイル
